column4: simple PC speakers? advanced klipsch/cambridge system? stereo/studio/dj amplifier+mixer -> pa?
if it's a problem in the jack or the cable within the first few inches of it, sure.
my thought is it might be something more sinister like the hardware that has naught to do with your computer.

after a substantial dB loss (ie: losing it's feed completely) sometimes causes the chips/resistors in either amplifiers or speakers to reset (Most speakers, if more than one cone, have a little circuit board in them that seperates out the frequencies so's to not blow the tweaters, etc)
only mp3s make it go out?
